item.title: S3 Outage: Software Minus Services
item.description: News Commentary. If Web services infrastructure is a utility, like electricity, shouldn't it be as reliable—or more?

item.title: Yahoo's Worth to Microsoft: $19 and Change
item.description: News Analysis. How the mighty Microsoft offers are laid low. Forget $31 per share for Yahoo, Microsoft will pay $19.50.

item.title: Microsoft Q4 2008 by the Numbers
item.description: News Analysis. This afternoon, Microsoft reported its last yearly earnings with Microsoft Chairman Bill Gates working in a full-time role. Well, well, Microsoft reached 60 before its chairman.

item.title: Vista: Victim of Enterprise Malaise
item.description: News Analysis. Windows Vista probably deserves a break, but it won't be getting one from enterprises.

item.title: Should You Mesh or Me?
item.description: News Analysis. Late yesterday, Microsoft quietly opened up the Live Mesh Technical Preview to most anyone in the United States—less than a week after Apple launched MobileMe. Coincidence? Yeah, right.

item.title: Vista: DOA in the Enterprise
item.description: News Analysis. But you knew that already, right?

item.title: Microsoft Pooh-Poohs Yahoo
item.description: News Analysis. Corporate finger pointing is fraught with deceit; nobody is believable. Saturday, Yahoo wagged its finger in accusation. Today, Microsoft pointed back.

item.title: Microsoft to Yahoo: Set the Record Straight
item.description: News Brief. Today, Microsoft finally responded to Yahoo's weekend letter about Friday's joint offer with billionaire business buster Carl Icahn.

item.title: If Icahn Not Have Yahoo, Boo Hoo!
item.description: News Commentary. In "Coma," patients' brains are killed during surgical operations, and their organs sold one part at a time to the highest bidder.

item.title: Yahoo's No Icahn Do Letter
item.description: News Brief. Yahoo spills the takeover dirt in a weekend letter about a new Microsoft offer received on Friday and promptly rejected.

item.title: What Microsoft Should Learn from iPhone 3G
item.description: News Analysis. Be prepared. Apple wasn't ready.

item.title: iPhone, Exchange in Sync
item.description: Podcast. Exchange closed out a big week, with pricing released on the hosted version and launch of Apple's iPhone 3G.

item.title: Can There Be 'Wow' in Vista Marketing?
item.description: News Commentary. Yesterday's Microsoft marketing bravado is just too funny. So now, 17 months after general availability, Microsoft will promote Windows Vista? Get a life.

item.title: Stephen, Can You Bring Some Flash to Microsoft?
item.description: News Commentary. Stephen Elop sounds like a team player.

item.title: Round About eWEEK, 7-9-08
item.description: News Brief. My eWEEK colleagues have busted their butts writing Microsoft news and analysis that didn't make Microsoft Watch (there's no time to do everything).
